menuscreen
Class PlayerStatusListener

java.lang.Object
  menuscreen.PlayerStatusListener
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener
public class PlayerStatusListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

Author:
Geoffrey Long Provides a way to map key presses to actions, and a way to listen to the PlayerStatusUpdate for a signal to start the game.

Constructor Summary
PlayerStatusListener(PlayerPanel paneOne, PlayerPanel paneTwo, boolean startRightAway)
          If startRightAway is true then the key bindings and start the timer, else simply add the PlayerPanels as class variables.
 
Method Summary
 void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
           
 boolean isReady()
          Checks to see the status of the status labels to see if the game is ready to be started
 void start()
          Start method to facilitate testing

Constructor Detail

PlayerStatusListener

public PlayerStatusListener(PlayerPanel paneOne,
                            PlayerPanel paneTwo,
                            boolean startRightAway)
If startRightAway is true then the key bindings and start the timer, else simply add the PlayerPanels as class variables.

Parameters:
paneOne - A PlayerOnePanel
paneTwo - A PlayerTwoPanel
startRightAway - Allows for easy testing

isReady

public boolean isReady()
Checks to see the status of the status labels to see if the game is ready to be started

Returns:
isReady True if both player status labels are equal and "ready", false otherwise
